content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is the implementation of the `clean_column` function in Julia:
```julia
function clean_column(col)
    # Lowercase the column name
    col = lower(col)
    
    # Strip leading and trailing whitespaces
    col = trim(col)
    
    # Replace spaces and hyphens with an underscore
    col = replace(col, " ", "-"), "_"
    
    return col
end
```

Here is an example of how to use the `clean_column` function in Julia:
```julia
# Define a column name to be cleaned
col_name = "My Column Name"

# Clean the column name using the `clean_column` function
cleaned_col_name = clean_column(col_name))

# Print the cleaned column name
println(cleaned_col_name))
```

This will output:
```julia
my_column_name
```
